results.title: Senior Manager, Financial Reporting
results.description:
We value those qualified applicants with lived experience as racialized people, Indigenous people, those who have experienced homelessness, mental illness, and who have diverse abilities, as well as people of all sexual orientations, women and trans people.

About Us:

Numinus Wellness (TSX: NUMI) helps people to heal and be well through the development and delivery of innovative mental health care and access to safe, evidence-based psychedelic-assisted therapies. The Numinus model - including psychedelic production, research, and clinic care - is at the forefront of a transformation aimed at healing rather than managing symptoms for depression, anxiety, trauma, pain and substance use. At Numinus, we are leading the integration of psychedelic-assisted therapies into mainstream clinical practice and building the foundation for a healthier society.

Our North Star

Be the most trusted brand in the psychedelic space.

Our Mission

We are bringing transformative healing to communities through innovative therapies backed by science and scalable operations.

Our Vision

A world where everyone feels connected and whole.

Our Values

  • Be in service to self and others
  • Build something that captures our collective ideals
  • Be dedicated to the art and the science
  • Have courage to do the right thing
  • Be committed to doing our part in the process of Truth and Reconciliation with Indigenous Peoples


Job Summary:

Reporting to the Corporate Controller, the Senior Manager, Financial Reporting will be a key player in owning the financial reporting and compliance for Numinus. Working closely with the operational and corporate finance team, the Senior Manager, Financial Reporting will be responsible for ensuring timely and accurate financial and management reporting while adhering to the company’s strict reporting deadlines. The Senior Manager, Financial Reporting will identify strengths and opportunities for optimization within business processes and the Company’s control framework in order to minimize risk and increase the quality of financial information.


In addition to these core deliverables, the Senior Manager, Financial Reporting will lead key initiatives including defining and enhancing business processes by working with cross functional stakeholders to provide their accounting expertise to ensure all aspects are conducive from an accounting, compliance as well as business perspective.

 

The Senior Manager, Financial Reporting will demonstrate strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with internal stakeholders.

As a key member of the Corporate Finance team, the Senior Accountant must have the ability to:

  • Prepare consolidated financial statements and related supporting documentation under IFRS on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis for publicly listed companies in the US.
  • Review and reconcile intercompany transactions and balances, generate intercompany elimination adjustments.
  • Coordinate and assist with the Company’s quarterly review and annual audits with our external auditors.
  • Implementation of SOX compliance programs.
  • Create and update accounting policies as required.
  • Be an agent of change through building systems and processes in continuous improvement process.
  • Manage multiple deadlines, prioritize tasks accordingly and meet the expectations of multiple stakeholders (corporate finance team, external auditors, senior leadership, clinic managers)
  • Be flexible and work collaboratively as a team, taking on new tasks as needed to achieve the goal of timely, accurate and actional reporting.
  • Demonstrate excellent written communication skills providing clear and logical reasoning to support a structured argument.


WHO YOU ARE

Position Requirements:

  • A professional accounting designation (CPA).
  • 5+ years of experience of consolidating financial statements with multi-location environments.
  • Experience with revenue generating, scale-up phase, US publicly listed companies.
  • Experience with IFRS and controls and compliance.
  • Experience and knowledge of US GAAP would be great to have.
  • Experience in health care, retail or service industry would be amazing.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong communication and listening 
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Time management skills
  • Problem-solving  
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to take initiatives

 

At Numinus, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and accessible work environment. We welcome and celebrate differences because we believe a multitude of perspectives fosters innovation and will help us achieve our ultimate purpose of delivering the highest quality outcomes to the people we serve. Our culture is one of belonging in which each person is accepted and valued for their individuality. As such, if you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know so we can work with you to meet your needs.

We thank all of those who take the time to apply; however, only those short-listed will be contacted.

results.title: Accounting Manager
results.description:
Accounting Manager - up to 60k dependent on experience. This position is remote and open to applicants in the UK. We cannot sponsor any visas for this role. 

Linnworks is one of the fastest growing eCommerce SaaS platforms in EMEA and with our recent US acquisition of Skuvault, our growth trajectory is incredible!! 

Due to continued growth, an exciting opportunity has arisen in Linnworks' growing Global Finance team. This is an all-encompassing role where the successful candidate will have exposure to a variety of responsibilities across entities in the UK, USA, and Estonia. This is primarily a remote role. Occasional travel to our Head Office in Chichester may be required (for example, onboarding and occasional team days in the office).

What you'll be doing

  • Managing accounting preparations/operations (Billing, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Employee Expenses, Payroll, Fixed Assets, Prepaids, Accruals, General Ledger, and Revenue Recognition), ensuring all balance sheet accounts have appropriate supporting documentation. 
  • Preparing and publishing timely monthly/quarterly/year-end consolidated management accounts. Preparing and reviewing annual statutory accounts. 
  • Performing detailed analysis of the company's internal controls, identifying weaknesses and rolling out control remediations.
  • Documenting business processes and accounting policies when appropriate (or keeping them up to date) to maintain and strengthen internal controls. Driving automation of routine processes. 
  • Administering payroll, including payroll compliance, and handling queries related to payroll. Administering the UK pension scheme. 
  • Ensuring all financial reporting is compliant with statutory law and financial regulations (VAT, PAYE, etc).
  • Supervising and managing the Accounting team and collaborating when required with other business functions.
  • Responding to inquiries from the CFO, Head of FP&A, Head of Finance, HR, Legal and company wide managers regarding financial results, special reporting requests etc.
  • Co-ordinating and liaising with the auditors and managing the Group's audit engagement providing high quality information, ensuring the audits are completed on time and with ever-reducing number of audit differences.
  • Managing ad hoc projects (cross functional process improvements, implementation of new tools…).

What you'll bring to the role

  • ACA, ACCA, or CIMA qualified
  • 5 - 7 years experience, beginning in audit at a Big 4 or top 10 firm, then experience gained in industry, preferably a SaaS business.
  • The ideal candidate demonstrates a sense of urgency. They are ready to roll up their sleeves, tackle issues, and take the initiative to perform tasks without direction. They have a strong curiosity and are hungry to learn new systems, in other words, you independently explore and learn, driving your own growth.
  • A solid understanding of internal control design and operational efficiency. Willing to dive into processes performed by the wider team to identify improvements. 
  • Working understanding of US GAAP and FRS 102, and able to perform a thorough research of accounting issues.
  • Strong systems experience, including MS Excel, Google Sheets and Netsuite knowledge strongly preferred.
  • Payment processing experience: Stripe, GoCardless and Paypal
  • Experience with international intercompany transactions, consolidated management reports and financial statements.
  • Experience administering payroll preferred.
  • Experience with the preparation and submission of VAT returns.
  • Exceptional organisational, process management and presentation skills, and strong attention to detail
  • Experience managing and motivating staff, providing guidance on how they can upskill and grow their career. 
  • You are able to work independently to tight month/year-end deadlines in scaleups.

Nice to haves

  • Experience of working in a fast paced start-up or scale-up where you have really been in the detail and driven improvement of the Accounting function during a high growth period would be desirable.

THE GOOD STUFF

We embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage our amazing team members at Linnworks to bring their authentic, fun selves to work every day. We offer a culture of innovation, mutual respect, support, and transparency. The competitive and comprehensive benefits our team members enjoy are designed to ensure you and your family members are healthy.  

  • Fantastic team culture based on trust and belonging
  • Remote + flexible working ⏰(occasional face to face meetings, ideally once a month)
  • Laptop & a work-from-home budget – Get a personal budget of £500 to set up your home office
  • Mental well-being support - Access therapy, mental health sessions, and yoga through a free subscription to Headspace & EAP 
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays ⛱
  • Opportunity to learn and master a lot of cool skills
  • Training, support and personal development
  • Participation in our companies equity scheme

Who we are:

As the global leader in the eCommerce automation sector, Linnworks has one mission: Giving our clients back their time to grow and lead their brands. Companies wanting to sell their products via marketplaces like Amazon, eBay, Facebook, etc need a platform to automate and monitor retail, inventory and shipping processes and performance. We have teams across North America and Europe, and we are backed by Marlin Equity Partners, a leading growth equity firm headquartered out of California. 

Linnworks not only has the market-leading product for e-commerce automation but also attracts the best people in the industry. Highly skilled, passionate, and collaborative with a winning and customer-centric attitude - we pride ourselves on our people.  

Life at Linnworks:

Linnworks is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer (EoE). We believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background leads to a better environment for our employees, and better service for our customers. The training and development of our employees is something we value deeply. We are committed to continuous investment into their personal growth, providing clear paths for career progression, and equipping them with the tools and training required to become experts in their profession.

Linnworks is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

results.title: Claims Handler- Personal Injury
results.description:
About us

We are Zego - a commercial motor insurance provider that powers opportunities for businesses, from entire fleets of vehicles to self-employed drivers and riders. We combine best-in-class technology with sophisticated data sources to offer insurance products that save businesses time and money.

Since our inception, we have believed that the problem with traditional insurance is that it holds back businesses. It’s too expensive and time consuming, and it no longer suits businesses that use vehicles to earn money. Our products represent a solution to this problem for businesses based across the UK, Europe and beyond.

So far, we have raised over $200 million in funding and we were the first UK insurtech to be valued at over $1 billion. We are also the first to be awarded our own insurance licence and recently won Tech Company of the Year 2020.

At Zego, we are proud to say we have a diverse and inclusive team, unified by our shared values and mission. Our people are the most important part of our story and everybody at Zego, no matter their role, has an integral part to play.

The purpose of the role Personal Injury Claims Handler:

We are growing our Claims department and we are looking for an experienced Personal Injury Claims handler to join our busy and vibrant team.

The Personal Injury Claims handler will work as part of our wider claims team and will be responsible for managing a caseload of personal injury claims by confirming indemnity position for each claim as well as manage Third Party Property Damage (TPPD), including credit hire claims within Zego’s delegated authority limit whilst driving down claims spend. Therefore motor claims handling experience in the personal injury space is a must along with excellent negotiation skills to be able to achieve the best commercial settlements.

The Personal Injury Claims will be working with a team of highly skilled and successful claims experts as well as our new and innovative, API first claims management system to support the delivery of a world-leading Claims service to our UK customers while ensuring the business has access to high-quality claims data and fighting fraud.

This is a great opportunity for a Personal Injury Claims Handler who would like to further their claims experience and professional development with a fast-paced and innovative company that likes to do things a little differently.

What you'll be working on as a Personal Injury Claims Handler:

  • Responsible for proactively managing a caseload of personal injury claims within authority as well as identify any large loss and sensitive claims at an early stage.
  • Identify and pursue all potential recoveries from the relevant parties.
  • Develop and maintain effective relationships with colleagues, commercial customers, brokers and business partners where required.
  • Manage claim costs within personal allocation by achieving the most economical settlement.
  • Identify potential fraudulent claims and action in accordance with Zego’s guidelines.
  • Be responsible for personal development requirements in specialist areas, by attending all internal/external training sessions.

What you will need to be successful as a Personal Injury Claims Handler:

  • Strong claims handling experience (private and commercial) in an insurance company - desirably with an Insurtech or Motor Insurance provider.
  • Personal accident claims experience is highly desirable however not essential.
  • Strong understanding of the credit hire market, impecuniosity and the utilisation of basic hire rates as well as understanding of the Civil Procedure Rules and cost
  • Experience working on personal injury claims within/out of the OIC/MOJ RTA portals
  • Excellent communication skills with an ability to develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and customers.

What it's like to work @ Zego:

Zego has a truly international and inclusive team, unified by great ideas and collaborative thoughtfulness. Our people are the most important part of our story and everyone plays an essential role in our journey. We look for people who have expertise, enthusiasm and who are motivated by change. There’s plenty of room to learn and grow, as part of our ongoing training programmes or directly from other experts. You’ll work alongside a talented group of people who respect each other's differences and seek to understand fresh perspectives.

 
Where we work:

We are committed to helping all Zegons deliver their best work regardless of location which is why we have embraced a ‘Flex First’ philosophy. This means home is the primary place of work for all Zegons but you can also spend time with colleagues in our city centre collaboration spaces from time to time too

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

#LI-REMOTE

results.title: Data Analyst
results.description:
Avint LLC is seeking a motivated, career, and customer-oriented Data Analyst to join our team in the Herndon, VA area to provide unparalleled support to multiple federal agencies through the Continuous Diagnostics & Mitigation (CDM) Program. The CDM Program is a high-profile, high-visibility, cybersecurity modernization and risk management program where you can contribute innovative solutions and consult with multiple federal agencies to enhance their Information Assurance (IA) programs and continuous monitoring capabilities.

This position also requires developing analysis and reporting of Data, including identifying data gaps. The successful candidate will bring a consultative approach to data analysis in solving our clients’ cyber security problems, coupled with demonstrated experience designing and developing enterprise data solutions for Federal government clients. This is not a database administrator role, but a hands-on Data Analyst position.

Position Responsibilities:

  • Review, Identify, Analyze data from multiple source Cyber Security tools at multiple agencies.
  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports based on the customer needs.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary and other data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Run ad-hoc reports from source systems and work with Tool SMEs, integration developers in identifying data defects.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Analyze source data and types, identify data requirements for destination systems.
  • Analyze, interpret, and report on data based on Data Dictionary & Logical Data Models guidance.
  • Work with Agency and Agency representatives in resolving data quality, completeness, and accuracy issues.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Ensure mapping of data elements provided by COTS products to the Logical Data Model
  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Able to obtain and maintain a DHS Suitability/Entry on Duty (EOD) Active Secret or Top-Secret clearance desired.

Technical Areas of Expertise

  • Excellent communication and relationship skills to articulate given analysis and build consensus among clients and technical stakeholders
  • Demonstrated ability to present to senior leadership and client audiences
  • Strong interpersonal and collaborations skills working in a team-oriented environment
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and handle multiple agencies simultaneously
  • Microsoft Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
  • Experience with JIRA and Agile development practices
  • Certification: Security+CE plus

Qualifications

  • Proven working experience with large Data set from multiple systems including machine data, cyber security tool data and other relevant data that is used within an enterprise for security posture.
  • Proficient at querying data in MS/Azure SQL server and Elasticsearch/Kibana for data issues, gaps, and trend
  • Writing reports and presenting findings
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL, MySql etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
  • Experience in translating derived requirements by analyzing Logical Data Models and Data Dictionary to provide data mapping from source systems.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Experience with collaborating with other roles, such as solution architects, data engineers, data scientists, AI engineers, database administrators, and developers.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in Data Analytic work for mission critical systems within Fed/CIV, DOD, or Intel
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience performing or assisting in the analysis of enterprise IT logs, data, and/or information preferably in Security Operations
  • Experience collaborating with Federal clients to mature operational processes, reduce redundancies, and develop innovative solutions
  • Experience understanding organizational needs, proposing solutions, and managing project execution efforts designed to deliver overall program benefits for Government Agencies
  • Experience collaborating with US Government Agencies, state or local governments, or commercial entities to develop IT service program maturity in accordance with Federal IT mandates and best practices
  • Experience in conducting assessments of an Enterprise by reviewing technical documentation, conducting interviews and workshops to identify gaps and develop a tailored solution is highly desired
  • Demonstrated experience in security solution design using existing as well as emerging technologies to deliver enterprise solutions
  • BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Physical Requirements

  • Office work, typically sedentary with some movement around the office

Benefits

Joining Avint is a win-win proposition! You will feel the personal touch of a small business and receive BIG business benefits. From competitive salaries, full health, and generous PTO and Federal Holidays. Additionally, we encourage every Avint employee to further their professional development. To assist you in achieving your goals, we offer reimbursement for courses, exams, and tuition. Interested in a class, conference, program, or degree? Avint will invest in YOU and your professional development!

Avint is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

results.title: Copywriter and Localization Manager
results.description:
The Air Apps team is hiring highly motivated teammates to help build, maintain and market our mobile applications. We are a 100% remote company with just over 50+ employees working across the globe every single day to build products that enrich people's lives. We combine the simplicity and greatness of Apple products by creating utility and productivity apps that make people's lives easier. Our portfolio contains Translate Now & Calculator Air, both the fastest-growing apps in their category. Our apps have been downloaded over 90 million times and received over 2 million ratings with an average of 4.7 stars.

Mission

At Air Apps, we intend to make people's life easier by offering software solutions that allow people to perform their daily activities in work, social, fitness, and learning right from their mobile devices.

About the role

The copywriter and localization manager has a vital role in our Marketing and Product Department. They create clear, concise copy for apps, ads, articles, and marketing material. They ensure the content developed is accessible in other languages, not only in English. They are responsible for creating content to enhance user’s experience with our apps, showcase the benefits of our apps to the rest of the world, attract new users and engage existing ones.

Responsibilities
Content

  • Write the English copy for our product descriptions, articles, marketing campaigns, App Store optimized texts, push and in-app notifications, strings and other ad hoc requests.

  • Incorporate brand voice and follow brand guidelines when producing content and ensure the content upholds authenticity for the users

  • Create content campaigns and designed to meet company targets and broader business goals while analyzing the competition so we can strive to do better

  • Process briefs to deliver content that meet the expected goals and deadlines while making necessary edits based on the team's feedback.

  • Maintain strict standards of quality control to ensure content is consistent, accurate, and relevant for our customers

  • Continuously seek to improve processes and workflows for your areas of responsibility and constantly strive for higher quality outputs

  • Brainstorm ideas with other team members, seek inspiration online, or use other methods that allow your creativity to flourish

  • Collaborate with marketing, product, development, and other design team members

Localization

  • Create content from initial concept to final handoff: handle all aspects of creating and localizing content, from brainstorming, creating, editing, proofreading, managing localization efforts and teams, etc.

  • Manage and oversee the localization strings for App Store optimized text in 37 languages whilst documenting in localization spreadsheets and software

  • Review existing localized text assets and strings.

  • Analyze and implement content creation and localization trends.

  • Maintain a rigorous schedule that meets deadlines, capacity and quality targets. Divide localization task responsibilities by language, delegate them to relevant teams and monitor the work

 
Expected daily activities

  • Write product descriptions, marketing texts and notifications, articles, App Store optimized texts, strings etc.

  • Write clear and error-free content for several online and mobile channels that reflect the company’s voice, brand image and target audience

  • Propose copy concepts in an engaging way for mobile users and carry out projects once they are approved

  • Text editing and proofreading

  • Manage and oversee the localization of English texts into several languages

  • Post content to relevant online and mobile channels

  • Add to content and localization guidelines

  • Collaborate with other marketing team members and across teams on slack

  • Update project statuses on Jira

  • Backup and organize files on Google Drive

  • Manage key paid user acquisition channels while targeting performance ROAS/KPI goals.
  • Manage your channels end to end, including developing channel strategy, defining targeting, managing creatives, setting up campaigns, optimizing campaigns, measuring performance, and driving insights for future campaigns.
  • Use a data-driven approach & a vigorous testing process to evaluate hypotheses and extract insights on strategy and performance.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the customer experience and data flow from acquisition and engagement to drive conversions & revenues.
  • Use reporting and monitoring systems to distill performance to managers regularly.
  • Collaborate with content creators, including the creative team, to help create new and innovative messaging and customer touch-points.
 
Your opportunity

We offer a fully remote, results-driven work style that enhances productivity and quality, providing excellent work-life balance. We also have great opportunities to connect within our international team through coffee calls, team meetings, and hackathons.

  • Proven startup with significant ambitions
  • Highly competitive salary and bonuses
  • Flexible work environment, 100% remote
  • Apple hardware environment
  • USD100.00 Monthly allowance (Home office, Learning, Wellness)
  • USD350.00 Home office set up
  • Get-together: next is in May 2023 → Berlin, Germany

 

Statutory benefits
  • Health insurance (or your country's standard)
  • 24 Annual vacation days (or your country's standard)
  • 10 days sick leave (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks parental leave (or your country's standard)
  • National holidays (or your country's standard)
  • Plus any other statutory benefit in your country

You aspire to join an energetic team in a fast-growing startup to develop and grow products at scale. Your desired skills and experience include:

  • Proficient in English

  • Embrace change; able to thrive in a Startup environment

  • 3+ Years as a copywriter and/or localization manager

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Strong time and task management skills

  • Strong eye for detail

  • Be a team player with the ability to effectively communicate with people from different backgrounds and experience levels

  • Work effectively with multi-functional and international teams

  • Work highly collaborative, without any micro-management necessary

  • Work agile and fast, very fast

  • Receive and provide constructive feedback

  • Love remote life and believe in a fluid work/life environment:

  • Find the needle in the haystack mentality and solve problems methodically

  • Juggle multiple projects at the same time

  • Communicate heavily about statuses and issues

  • Manager of one mentality

  • Use Slack and other remote communication/reporting tools

 
What Happens Next?

We expect to review your application ASAP. You'll hear from us within 2-3 days if we decide to invite you to a technical exercise. The exercise is representative of the kind of day-to-day work you'd be doing on the team. We usually only invite candidates to this stage that meet minimum standards, and those candidates should expect to spend about 2-3 hours completing this test.

The next phase of the hiring process will be a video interview with our people operations manager (approx. 30 min). You and she will talk through your background and your approach to remote, teamwork and Air Apps. After the people interview, the top candidates will proceed to the team interview stage. You'll talk with 1-2 members of the team about your technical knowledge, experience and discuss the position (approx. 1h).

The top candidates will proceed to the final interview stage. You'll talk to the leadership team and will align yours and the company's expectations. We aim to make an offer 3-5 days after your final interview.

Please note that we're unable to offer individual feedback during the process. We usually see 1,000+ applications, and our team can't provide personalized feedback. It is a demanding application process. We appreciate you giving us that consideration, and we promise to provide you with our full attention in return.

Disclaimer

This position is fully REMOTE; no re-allocation or visa sponsorship is provided. You will work from any country Air Apps hires in,  however, you will be hired in your legal country of residency.

results.title: Growth Marketing Specialist
results.description:
Are you a marketing wizard with a knack for growth hacking? Do you have a passion for paid marketing and a love for all things digital? If so, we may have the perfect role for you!

We're seeking a mid-level growth marketing guru to join our dynamic team at Wolf.xyz, a B2B SaaS startup that helps staffing companies launch their own talent marketplaces.

As our new growth marketing superhero, you'll be responsible for driving business growth through various digital marketing channels, including LinkedIn ads, Google Ads, SEO, and email marketing. You'll also have the opportunity to get creative and test out new marketing strategies to help us reach our growth goals.

But let's be real, this isn't your typical 9-to-5 job. You'll need to be a quick learner, have a strong work ethic, and be able to roll with the punches (because let's face it, startups can be unpredictable).

So if you're ready to take on a new challenge and join a team of passionate tech team, apply now! We can't wait to see what you've got in store for us.

Key Skills required:

  • Experience with paid marketing channels, such as LinkedIn ads, Google Ads, and social media advertising
  • Knowledge of SEO and how to optimize website content for search engines
  • Proficiency with email marketing platforms and techniques
  • Ability to analyze marketing data and use it to inform strategy and decision-making
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to think outside the box
  • Experience with A/B testing and other growth hacking techniques
  • Familiarity with project management tools and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively
  • Experience working with B2B SaaS or tech companies is a plus

What you'll be doing:

  • Develop and execute a growth marketing strategy to drive user acquisition and engagement
  • Plan and execute paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Facebook and LinkedIn Ads
  • Develop and maintain email marketing campaigns to funnel leads and drive conversions
  • Analyze and report on the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, using tools such as Google Analytics
  • Collaborate with the product teams to optimize the user journey and conversion funnel
  • Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in growth marketing

What we offer:

  • Ability to work remotely
  • Employee stock options and annual performance bonuses
  • Opportunity to learn exciting new skills and grow your career
  • This is a full-time role with US-based location preferred. Global OK

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
Full-time •  Competitive Pay • Excellent Benefits • Work from Anywhere in the Contiguous U.S. 

MoveOn is a people-powered force for progress. We wield independent political power by bringing millions together to take action to create a country with a place of honor and dignity for everyone—where all are welcome, we take care of one another, and where everyone is set up to thrive.

For more than a generation, MoveOn has been a bulwark against the radical right and has channeled millions of voices to end wars, protect democracy, and advance justice for all. We've built political power for progressive change through mobilizing the left to Democrats so that we can advance our vision of an America for all.

MoveOn is the largest multi-issue digital first political campaigning organization in the country. We drive rapid-response campaigns at scale on a multitude of key issues at high-impact moments while building sustainable campaigns that resonate and grow over time. Whether its democracy, health care, foreign policy, economic justice, immigration or otherwise, MoveOn provides our members with timely ways to take action for change. 

The UX Designer plays a key role in supporting campaigns and member growth through creating excellent user experience and design across digital tools and member-facing products. As part of the Product team, the UX Designer collaborates with cross functional teams to research, ideate, create, test, and implement design solutions that will uplift MoveOn’s values and mobilize millions members and volunteer leaders, while providing a positive user experience through intuitive interfaces and user flows.

Responsibilities: 

  • Support the Lead Designer in executing MoveOn’s design vision and roadmap. 
  • Manage small- to medium-sized projects while actively prioritizing workflow based on organizational and Product team strategic priorities.
  • Be a consistent advocate for customer-centric choices for all products across MoveOn by uplifting design thinking approaches and promoting tools to improve accessibility, drive organic reach, and promote engagement.
  • As part of the Product team, conceptualize thoughtful, original design ideas that incorporate MoveOn member feedback and improve digital experiences on moveon.org web properties.
  • Use shared language and structured processes to collaborate with engineers, data analysts, project managers, and fellow designers from research to execution; translate complex, cross-team design requests into clear tasks and decisions needed.
  • Focus on user experience and usability of products; utilizing prototypes and user flow optimization as needed.
  • Create Wordpress and other design templates for common use cases
  • Create and implement design changes for A/B testing on digital tools and email
  • Develop design assets optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces consistent with MoveOn’s branding and component library
  • Assist in usability studies for prototypes, as-needed

Required skills and experience

  • Design skills:
    • Experience and proficiency in graphic and ux design in a professional environment
    • Proficiency in information architecture and experience with design and wireframing tools, including  Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Figma and more. 
    • Ability to incorporate diverse and sometimes conflicting feedback into the design cycle and explain the purpose behind design decisions
    • Knowledge of best practices and trends in design, particularly for mobile, accessibility, and email
    • Familiarity with the UX research process
    • Ability to creatively solve problems in a rapid response environment.
  • Technical skills:
    • Knowledge of HTML/CSS and PHP and JS to build the front end of your designs while working with a team of software engineers in a variety of environments. 
    • Experience or interest in conversion rate optimization
    • QA Experience including user acceptance, compatibility, and accessibility testing  
    • Experience or interest in learning MoveOn’s suite of web tools, including WordPress, ActionKit, and Optimizely
    • Experience with WordPress plugins such as Elementor and GA is a plus 
  • Professional skills:
    • Self-directed with effective time management skills and proven ability to juggle multiple projects at once  
    • Strong attention to detail, from design to technical implementation
    • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely

Reports to: Director of Product

Location: Position may be based anywhere in the contiguous United States. May require occasional travel.

results.title: Safer Gambling Analyst
results.description:
We are looking for a Safer Gambling Analyst to join the team! This role provides central support to the Safer Gambling function within the Compliance Team. This role is based on shift work and is remote.

We have internal policies and procedures in place to help prevent the onset of problem gambling which include; self-exclusion, monitoring, affordability assessments, cross-function collaboration and allowing customers to set limits on their accounts.


This role will:
  • Engage with customers who may be at risk or are experiencing harm from gambling and take action where needed, in line with the procedures and policies.
  • Analyse customer accounts flagged by Safer Gambling triggers through internal reporting or interactions that indicate possible vulnerable customers and identify potential addictive behaviour.
  • Monitor customer activity
  • Escalate particular cases where necessary to ensure player protection is safeguarded.
  • Recommend changes or amendments to Safer Gambling processes.
  • Work closely with the Safer Gambling Manager to instil a culture of Safer Gambling through promoting awareness and training.
  • Conduct ad-hoc tasks as directed by the SG Manager and Head of Compliance.

 

This role is part of a multi-disciplinary role and will also follow procedures on AML and Fraud and Risk. Our Safer Gambling commitments include helping reduce the likelihood of problem gambling amongst vulnerable customers and reduce any associated gambling harms our customer base may experience.

Requirements

  • Have excellent oral, written and communication skills
  • Experience with having difficult conversations with customers.
  • Able to work with a number of stakeholders within the business to discuss the customer accounts to reach decisions.
  • Have attention to detail and the ability to quickly review and assess information.
  • Have clear understanding of Safer Gambling in line with the LCCP.
  • Be self-motivated, keen eye for detail, accurate and precise, can work alone or as part of a wider team
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Fluent in English if not a native speaker
  • Be based in the UK
  • Knowledge and experience of the online gambling industry are desirable but not essential as training will be provided.

Benefits

  • A ground-floor role in which you’ll be integral to our company culture and help shape the direction. You’ll be part of a growing community of Midnite employees, partners, investors, and advisors; all focused on our common goal. We love to do things together with regular company-wide meetups, games nights, and team retreats.
  • Comprehensive Health insurance via Vitality so you can stay healthy.
  • 25+ paid holidays and use-what-you-need sick days.
  • Paid maternity, paternity, and adoption leave.
  • A nursery salary sacrifice scheme allows you to pay your children's nursery fees directly from your paycheck.
  • Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid).
  • Generous stipends for headphones and your remote work setup.
  • Our team combines years of experience building world-class betting technology with deep esports and sports domain expertise. We are as intentional about building a durable company and inclusive culture as we are about perfecting our product and are serious about flexible work and professional development.

 

About us

Midnite is a next-generation betting platform that is built for today’s fandom. We are a collective of engineers, quants, designers, and marketers who all share a passion for esports, sports, and gaming. We exist to bring fans together and enhance their interactions with their favourite games through the rush of winning money. Whether you want to back your favourite football team or put some money down to win your next game in Call of Duty, Midnite lets you get some skin in the game. Designed and built from the ground up with the newest technologies, we made Midnite for all levels of fandom. Making Midnite intuitive, immersive, and immediately understandable is hard work. But we believe that by keeping this our north star, we can make something truly awesome.

We are backed by some of the world’s top investors that have brought you companies like Draftkings, Betfair, Revolut, Just Eat, and many more. With a central hub in London, we are a remote-first team spread out across the world all working together to shape a new era in wagering. Join us and become part of a passionate group of builders who are obsessed with crafting exceptional products for fans all over the world. We'd love your help.

 

Salary: £22,000
